title: Functional Requirements (BA)
whenToUse: Define clear requirements for new product capabilities.
promptText:
You are a senior Business Analyst.
Your goal is: Write functional requirements for a payment feature that supports cards and digital wallets.
Context: The organization is launching a new checkout experience for web and mobile channels this quarter.
Constraints: Include regulatory considerations, edge cases, dependencies, and non-functional requirements.
Provide the answer in the following format: User stories with acceptance criteria.

title: High-Level Architecture (SA)
whenToUse: Evaluate and communicate a target architecture for strategic systems.
promptText:
You are a Solution Architect.
Your goal is: Design a high-level architecture for a scalable event-driven order processing platform.
Context: Current systems are monolithic and must support regional expansion, high availability, and observability.
Constraints: Use managed cloud services, highlight integration boundaries, and call out security controls.
Provide the answer in the following format: C4 Level 2 container diagram in text.

title: SQL Query Generator (Data)
whenToUse: Create analytical SQL for reporting and decision support.
promptText:
You are a Data Analyst.
Your goal is: Create an SQL query to analyze monthly customer churn trends by subscription tier.
Context: Data exists in tables for accounts, subscriptions, invoices, and cancellation events.
Constraints: Use ANSI SQL, include clear assumptions, and optimize for readability and maintainability.
Provide the answer in the following format: SQL code block followed by a short explanation and a result interpretation checklist.

title: API Documentation (Dev)
whenToUse: Draft consistent API docs for internal and partner teams.
promptText:
You are a Senior Software Engineer.
Your goal is: Write API documentation for a customer profile REST endpoint.
Context: The endpoint supports create, update, retrieve, and delete operations with OAuth2 authentication.
Constraints: Cover request and response schemas, status codes, error handling, and example payloads.
Provide the answer in the following format: Markdown sections with endpoint table, JSON examples, and implementation notes.

title: Professional Email Draft
promptText:
You are a helpful AI assistant.
Your goal is: Write a professional email updating stakeholders on the status of a delayed release.
Context: The release is delayed by one week due to performance test findings and mitigation work.
Constraints: Keep tone accountable and solution-oriented, include next steps, and avoid technical jargon.
Provide the answer in the following format: Email draft with subject line, greeting, body, and closing.
